player: Thabo Sefolosha (groin) has been ruled out of Sunday's game vs. the Knicks.
Tiago Splitter (calf) will not play on Monday vs. the Clippers.
Caris LeVert will play against the Wolves on Saturday.
As expected, Brook Lopez (rest) will play Saturday vs. Minnesota.
Joe Harris (ankle) will not play Saturday vs. Minnesota.
The Nets announced that Jeremy Lin will miss another 3-5 weeks after aggravating his strained left hamstring.
Al Horford (groin) will not play against the Magic on Friday with Jonas Jerebko and Amir Johnson starting in the frontcourt.
Demetrius Jackson (illness) will not play on Tuesday vs. the Wizards.
Avery Bradley (Achilles) has been limited to pool conditioning and anti-gravity work.
Cody Zeller (quad) will not play against the Knicks on Friday and Jeremy Lamb (foot) will be available.
Brian Roberts (illness) will not suit up for Monday's game against the Wizards.
Jeremy Lamb (foot) picked up a DNP-CD on Friday vs. the Knicks.
J.R. Smith hasn't done any cardio exercises since fracturing his thumb on Dec. 20, but hopes to receive clearance to begin working out at his doctor's appointment on Friday.
Chris Anderson suffered a torn ACL in his right knee and will be out for the rest of the season.
Dirk Nowitzki (rest) is expected to return for Sunday's game against the Spurs.
Deron Williams (toe) has been ruled out for Sunday against the Spurs and Monday against the Cavs.
Wes Matthews (hip) is expected to play against the Spurs on Sunday.
J.J. Barea (left calf strain) is likely out until the All-Star break according to coach Rick Carlisle.
Kenneth Faried (hamstring) is listed as probable for Saturday's game vs. the Suns.
Wilson Chandler (neck) is listed as probable for Saturday's game vs. the Suns.
An MRI revealed Nikola Jokic has a left hip flexor strain and is listed as day-to-day.
Emmanuel Mudiay (back) will not travel with the Nuggets on their two-game road trip, meaning he will miss at least the next two games.
Michael Gbinije (right forearm bruise) is listed as doubtful for Friday's game vs. Utah.
Stephen Curry (left lateral quad soreness) is questionable for Saturday night's game against the Clippers
David West (thumb) is ramping up his activity and will be reevaluated early next week.
As expected, Eric Gordon (back) has been ruled out of Friday's game vs. the Sixers
Kevin Seraphin (knee) will not play Friday against the Kings.
Rodney Stuckey (hamstring) has been ruled out of Friday night's game against the Kings.
Chris Paul underwent successful surgery on Wednesday to repair a torn ligament in his left thumb, and he's expected to miss the next 6-8 weeks of action.
Brice Johnson (back) is nearing a return according to coach Doc Rivers.
Julius Randle (illness) has pneumonia and will be restricted from all activities for the next 2-3 days
D'Angelo Russell (knee, calf) will meet with team doctors in Los Angeles to hopefully get cleared to practice and play on Tuesday.
Troy Daniels (knee) will not play Friday against the Blazers.
Brandan Wright (left ankle surgery) wasn't on the active list for Wednesday's game.
Hassan Whiteside (sprained right ankle) is listed as questionable for Saturday's game vs. Detroit.
Tyler Johnson (strained left shoulder) is listed as questionable for Saturday's game vs. the Pistons.
Josh Richardson (foot) will miss at least the next two weeks of action.
Justise Winslow (right shoulder) had surgery to repair a torn labrum on Thursday and is expected to miss the rest of the season.
Josh McRoberts (stress reaction in left foot) is out indefinitely, according to coach Erik Spoelstra.
Nikola Pekovic hinted that he may retire from the game of basketball.
Khris Middleton (hamstring) has been aiming for a return near the All-Star break, according to C.F. Gardner of the Milwaukee Journal Sentinel.
Quincy Pondexter underwent successful arthroscopic left knee surgery on Wednesday morning.
Derrick Rose (ankle) is listed as doubtful to play against the Hawks on Sunday.
Lance Thomas (face) is still a week away from returning.
Enes Kanter (fractured right arm) had surgery on Friday and will be re-evaulated in about four weeks.
Jodie Meeks underwent surgery to correct his dislocated right thumb on Tuesday, and he will be out indefinitely.
Evan Fournier (foot) practiced on Saturday and the Magic are hopeful he can play Sunday against the Raptors.
Joel Embiid will not travel to Chicago for Sunday's game.
Jerryd Bayless (left wrist) had surgery on Thursday and is expected to miss the rest of the season.
76ers' head coach Brett Brown said that Ben Simmons (foot) is still "a ways away" from being cleared for 5-on-5 work.
Dragan Bender (ankle) will not play against the Nuggets on Thursday.
Moe Harkless (left calf) will not play on Friday vs. the Grizzlies.

Ed Davis (wrist) will not play on Friday against the Grizzlies.

because of an impending knee surgery.
Jonathon Simmons (wrist) has now been ruled out of Friday's game vs. the Pelicans.
Pau Gasol (left hand) is undergoing surgery to repair the fracture of his fourth metacarpal.

Omri Casspi will miss the next 1-2 weeks of action with a right calf injury.
DeMar DeRozan (ankle) is listed as questionable in the game notes for Sunday's matchup vs. the Magic.

Depending on upcoming test results, Ian Mahinmi could potentially return after the All-Star break.
